courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2010 Current Readings in Music Education 
A multi-disciplinary examination and application of the implications of critical theory for curriculum and pedagogy and the ways in which the educative environment can reflect this framework in music education. Particular attention will be paid to the performing arts and the ways in which our marginal status provides a powerful entry point into the conversation of 'general education.'

MPAME-GE 2021 Music Reference and Research Materials 
No Course Description Available

courses.course_name: Expanded Music and Its Impact on Teaching
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2022 Expanded Music and Its Impact on Teaching 
Exploration & use of electronic, multi-media, & other techniques in music parograms for the public schools.  Conversations with leading contemporary composers.

courses.course_name: The Teaching of Music in The Jr and Sr High Sch
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2027 The Teaching of Music in The Jr and Sr High Sch 
Music in the general curriculum.  Developing an understanding and perception of the process of musical thought appplicable to youth.  Students observe in selected schools.
MPAME-GE 2029 Ethics, Music, and Music Education

MPAME-GE 2031 Creative Performance Opportunities Music Ed 
Students serve as a production team that will create, rehearse, produce, and perform a culminating musical presentation at local venues. Such site may be schools, Senior Citizens Homes, Health Care Facilities, Community Centers. Students will assume the roles played by all personnel involved in putting on a performance, as well as becoming familiar with repertoire *music, lyrics, and dialogue) suited to the abilities of the performers.

courses.course_name: Music Education in a Cultural Context
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2032 Music Education in a Cultural Context 
Music's socio-ideological nature with special attention to: (a) the ways in which culture influences music education, music preference, music cognition, and musical values; and (b) the ways in which musical practices influence culture and social relations. Topics include: music education as intercultural education; music and gender; music and power; music as commodity; the educational implications of musical-cultural relativity; music education as an agent of social reproduction and transformation; music education as socialization process; music education as 'text'.

MPAME-GE 2033 Creative Process in Music Education 
Students create new work and music in the context of improvising, playing, composing, writing, moving, reflecting, meditating, and responding to the literature of creativity in the context of music education, composition, and the performing arts.

classes.format: Ind Instr in the Perform Arts

courses.course_name: Instrumental Techniques and Materials: Chamber Music
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2034 Instrumental Techniques and Materials: Chamber Music 
Rehearsal techniques and special problems in ensemble performance.

MPAME-GE 2035 Technological Trends in Music Education 
The impact of music technology and its implications for music education are examined. Students are introduced to Digital Audio, MIDI (Music Instrument Digital Interface) and the use of MIDI in providing music scores for classroom and ensembles as well as the use of MIDI in live performance in student ensembles. Students focus on techniques of special applications of music technology to music education on the Web and other digital media.

MPAME-GE 2052 Community Music 
Community Music is an emerging field of music education that challanges many traditional assumptions and forms of music teaching and learning. This course examines the conceptual, cultural, historical, sociological and pedagogical foundations of community music from a global perspective.

MPAME-GE 2055 Music Educ Technology in Classroom 
Seminar explores how common computer applications, music education courseware, digital audio, multimedia, and internet application technology can be applied in a music education setting.

courses.course_name: Problems in Music Educ Computer Asst Instruct
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2056 Problems in Music Educ Computer Asst Instruct 
An examination of current strategies in using the computer as an aid to a learning in music education. Current music software, CD-ROM, and internet resources are examined and evaluated. Students design the content for a computer-assisted instruction module at their level of service in their special areas of teaching music.

MPAME-GE 2057 Strtgy\Music Learn:Dstnc Ed, Mntr\Tchn\Msc/Msc Ed 
The role of the music mentor in in a culture that appears to be fully committed to technology as a solution to most contemporary problems. As students are introduced to a number of possibilities to extend mentoring capabilities they develop specific goals in music technology. Acquistion of music technologies will be in a context of focusing on teaching and learning in the process of making music.

MPAME-GE 2058 Music Ed Curriculum Development 
The philosophical, psychological, sociological, political, and practical bases of music curriculum design. Students will learn to integrate curriculum theory and practice by applying their studies in this course to practical curriculum development projects for their individual teaching situations.

MPAME-GE 2061 Psychology of Music Education 
This course analyzes a wide range of published research on relationships between music education and (1) behaviorism, (2) cognitive development thoery, (3) constructivism, (4) humanism, (5) human consciousness studies, (6) self-identity formation, (7) motivation theory, and (8) tests of musical intelligence and achievement. Music education contributes importantly to this dialectical exchange among competing and complementary theories.

MPAME-GE 2079 Jazz in Music Education 
A leading jazz educator explores jazz and jazz ensembles for educational settings, with emphasis on repertoire, rehearsal and performance techniques in developing musicianship and cultural understanding. For instrumentalists and vocalists.

courses.course_name: Learn Theor in Music & Music Educ
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2080 Learn Theor in Music & Music Educ 
Major theories concerning teaching and learning are explored in context of specific methodology for teaching music.

MPAME-GE 2082 Choral Materials and Techniques 
The choral rehearsal is more than just singing. This workshop provides hands-on experience with vocal and choral techniques, choral arranging and composition for various ensembles, including selection and development of repertoire, and involving students in the arranging, composing, and performing process.

classes.format: Ind Instr in the Perform Arts
classes.location: Breaux, Michael09/02/2015 - 12/15/2015 Wed 12.40 PM - 1.40 PM with Breaux, Michael

courses.description: MPAME-GE 2083 Concert Band

classes.format: Ind Instr in the Perform Arts

Ind Instr in the Perform Arts
Ind Instr in the Perform Arts
Ind Instr in the Perform Arts

courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2085 NYU Choral Arts Society 
Performance of the major choral literature.  The society presents concerts at many University and public functions.  Smaller ensembles are derived from the total membership.

MPAME-GE 2092 Field Observation and Participation 
No Course Description Available

courses.course_name: Choral Conducting Practicum for Music Ed
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2093 Choral Conducting Practicum for Music Ed 
Practical procedures and materials for conducting choral ensembles at all levels of music education. Students enrooled in this course demonstrate essential choral conducting techniques, knowledge of appropriate instrumental repertoire, and the ability to analyze and synthesize chamber and orchestral music scores for conception, interpretation, rehearsal, and performance.

MPAME-GE 2096 Advanced Instrumental Conducting 
No Course Description Available

MPAME-GE 2102 Fund of Conducting 
Basic principles of conductiong, patterns, cuing, score preparation, score reading, rehearsal and performance techniques.

MPAME-GE 2103 Guitar Practicum for Music Education 
A general introduction to teaching and learning guitar as a classroom instrument.

MPAME-GE 2104 Brass Practicum for Music Education 
An ensemble approach to teaching and learning brass instruments. Each student will experience with at least three different brass instruments.

MPAME-GE 2105 Woodwind Practicum for Music Education 
An ensemble approach to teaching and learning woodwind instrucments. Each student will have experience with at least three different wood instruments.

MPAME-GE 2106 Strings Practicum 
An ensemble approach to teaching and learning string instruments. Each student will have experieince with three to four different string instruments

MPAME-GE 2107 Percussion Practicum for Music Education 
An ensemble approach to teaching and learning percussion instruments. Students perform, compose/arrange, and conduct using various percussion configurations.

MPAME-GE 2108 Vocal Practicum for Music Education 
Introduction to vocal techniques and materials with emphasis on vocal development at all grade levels, including the changing voice.

courses.course_name: Instrumental Conducting Pracaticum for Music Ed
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2111 Instrumental Conducting Pracaticum for Music Ed 
Practical procedures and materials for conducting instrumental ensembles at all levels of music education. Students enrolled in this course demonstrate essential instrumental conducting techniques, knowledge of appropriate instrumental repertoire, and the ability to analyze and synthesize chamber and orchestral music scores for conception, interpretation, rehearsal, and performance.

MPAME-GE 2113 Music for Children 
Music and movement experiences for the classroom (K-6); cognitive basis for aesthetic sensitivity and expression.

MPAME-GE 2114 Music for Exceptional Children 
Music-movement experiences for individuals with mild to moderate impairment./dysfunction.  Emphasis on learning strategies in heterogeneous school classrooms.  Aesthetic factors in the individualized education program.

courses.course_name: Instrumental Materials & Techniques in Music Ed
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2115 Instrumental Materials & Techniques in Music Ed 
Instrumental materials and techniques suited to all levels of music instruction. Particular emphasis on assessment practices, diagnosis of instrumental problems, group methods, and individualized instruction including computer assisted technology.

courses.course_name: Teaching Music Comp and Inprov Middle & Sec Schl
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2116 Teaching Music Comp and Inprov Middle & Sec Schl 
Teaching musical creativity in the middle and secondary school. Through active involvement in various kinds of composing and improvising, and teaching these musical involvements, students will learn how to create, plan, and teach lessons in a variety of musical styles.

MPAME-GE 2118 Ind Study in Music Educ 
It should be noted that independent study requires a minimum of 45 hours of work per point. Independent study cannot be applied to the established professional education sequence in teaching curricula. Each departmental program has established its own maximum credit allowance for independent study. This information may be obtained from a student's department. Prior to registering for independent study, each student should obtain an Independent Study Approval Form from the adviser.

courses.course_name: Teaching of Music in The Elementary Grades
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2119 Teaching of Music in The Elementary Grades 
Integrated music and movement experiences in the development of elementary curricula for cognitive-affective growth.  Means and materials, published and self-devised.

courses.course_name: Research in Music and Music Ed
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2130 Research in Music and Music Ed 
No Course Description Available

courses.course_name: Basic Concepts in Music & Music Educ
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2139 Basic Concepts in Music & Music Educ 
Study of philosophical, psychological, and sociological concepts that form a foundation for the teaching of music.

courses.course_name: Spvr Stdnt Tch Music Elem Schools
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2141 Spvr Stdnt Tch Music Elem Schools 
See Bulletin for Requirements 'supervised Student Teaching' in Undergraduate/Graduate Study No Course Description.

courses.course_name: Sprv Std Tch Music in Scnd Schools
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2145 Sprv Std Tch Music in Scnd Schools 
See Bulletin for Requirements 'supervised Student Teaching' in Undergraduate/Graduate Study No Course Description.

MPAME-GE 2146 Music for Children: Kodaly 1 
Kodaly's philosophy through seven subject areas: Voice Pedagogy, Modally Methodology 1 (preschool through second grade level, and older beginners); Solfege 1 (pentatonic, major, minor solfeggi); Chorus; Traditional Materials and Research (world music); Choral Conducting 1 (arm, hand, and body choreography, beat patterns, basic expression); and Recorder Pedagogy; and Ensembles (beginning and advanced

MPAME-GE 2147 Music for Children: Kodaly 2 
Chorus conducting, Recorder Pedagogy and Ensembles are designed to best utilize students' skills. Course work also includes Modally Methodology 2 (third and fourth grade levels, continuing work with the competent and proficient school students, and daily and long-range lesson planning). Students develop traditional song collections and prepare to videotape a Kodaly-based lesson. Students follow Kodaly-based musicianship in Solfeggi 2 (addition of modal solfege and chord work), and Choral Conducting 2 (complex beat patterns, expressive gestures for dynamics and articulation, phrasing).

MPAME-GE 2148 Music for Children: Kodaly 3 
Chorus, Recorder Pedagogy, and Ensembles are custom-designed for students' needs. Course work includes Modally methodology 3 (fifth and sixth grade school levels, middle school, continuing work with the older beginners, and curriculum planning) and Choral Conducting 3 (all beat patterns, expressive gestures, rehearsal planning). Students continue advanced Modally based musicianship in Solfeggi 3 (modal, diatonic, and chromatic solfeggi, complex chord progressions). Students complete their traditional song collections

MPAME-GE 2149 Introduction Orff and Kodally Methods 
Introduction to concepts and practices in the Orff and Kodaly methods for music education.

courses.course_name: Kodaly Pract I: Solfege Praxis Lev 1
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2161 Kodaly Pract I: Solfege Praxis Lev 1 
Develops teacher's ability to use tools of Modally movable tonic solfeggi, rhythm syllables, and development of the following skills: conducting, inner hearing, dictation's, improvisation, and part work.

courses.course_name: Kodaly Pract I: Solfege Praxis Lev 2
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2162 Kodaly Pract I: Solfege Praxis Lev 2 
Continuation of Solfeggi Praxis I. Develops the teacher's ability to use tools of Modally, movable tonic solfeggi, rhythm syllables, and development of following skills: conducting, inner hearing, dictation, improvisation, and part work.

courses.course_name: Kodaly Pract I: Solfege Praxis Lev 3
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2163 Kodaly Pract I: Solfege Praxis Lev 3 
Continuation of Solfeggi Praxis II. Develops the teacher's ability to use tools of Modally, movable tonic solfeggi, rhythm syllables, and development of following skills: conducting, inner hearing, dictation, improvisation, and part work.

courses.course_name: Kodaly Pract II: Choral Cond Praxis Lev 1
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2164 Kodaly Pract II: Choral Cond Praxis Lev 1 
Development of choral conducting techniques: posture, beat patterns, signals for expressive singing (dynamics and articulation), and cueing entrances and cut-offs in polyphonic music.

courses.course_name: Kodaly Practicum II: Choral Conducting Praxis - Level 2
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2165 Kodaly Practicum II: Choral Conducting Praxis - Level 2 
Continuation of Choral Conducting Praxis - Level 1. Development of choral conducting techniques: posture, beat patterns, signals for expressive singing (dynamics and articulation), and cueing entrances and cut-offs in polyphonic music.

courses.course_name: Kodaly Pract II: Choral Cond Praxis Lev 3
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2166 Kodaly Pract II: Choral Cond Praxis Lev 3 
Continuation of Choral Conducting Praxis - Level 2. Development of choral conducting techniques: posture, beat patterns, signals for expressive singing (dynamics and articulation), and cueing entrances and cut-offs in polyphonic music.

MPAME-GE 2167 Kodaly Pract III Chorus Praxis 
Provides student with the choral performance experience. Rehearses on a regular basis.

MPAME-GE 2168 Kodaly Pract IV: Voice Praxis 
Student learns physiology of the voice, technique of posture, breath management, fountain, resonant tone production, diction and expression, and explores activities appropriate for young voices.

courses.course_name: Kodaly Pract VI: Tradit Folk Mat & Resrch
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2170 Kodaly Pract VI: Tradit Folk Mat & Resrch 
Offers experience in song collecting of traditional (folk) music.

courses.course_name: Kodaly Pract VII: Method Praxis Lev 1
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2171 Kodaly Pract VII: Method Praxis Lev 1 
Introduces student to philosophy and practice of Kodaly-based curriculum. Praxis in traditional song literature, music literature, and curriculum development.

courses.course_name: Kodaly Ptact VII: Method Praxis Lev 2
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2172 Kodaly Ptact VII: Method Praxis Lev 2 
Continuation of Modally Methodology Praxis - Level 1. Introduces student to philosophy and practice of Kodaly-based curriculum. Praxis in traditional song literature, music literature, and curriculum development.

courses.course_name: Kodaly Pract VII: Method Praxis Lev 3
courses.description:
MPAME-GE 2173 Kodaly Pract VII: Method Praxis Lev 3 
Continuation of Modally Methodology Praxis - Level 1. Introduces student to philosophy and practice of Kodaly-based curriculum. Praxis in traditional song literature, music literature, and curriculum development.

MPAME-GE 2939 Colloquy in Music Ed 
Synthesis of learning theories demonstrated through individual thesis projects.
